school_name: Yew Chung International School of Shanghai

result.trip_overview_narrative: YCIS Shanghai offers a range of educational trips and excursions integrated into the curriculum across grade levels. Primary students (Years 1-3) take field trips around Shanghai to cultural sites, parks, museums, and farms to use their Chinese language skills. Upper Primary students (Years 5-6) participate in educational trips and overnight camps to develop independence and collaboration. Middle School students (Years 7-9) engage in the Education Outside of the Classroom (EOTC) program, traveling to key cultural regions in China such as Xi'an, Shandong, and Fujian. High School students (Years 10-11) undertake educational and service trips within China, including visits to rural primary schools supported by the school's charity program for service and volunteer work.

evidence.quote: for the students in Years 1-3, their education extends beyond the classroom to integrate their learning and use their Chinese language skills on field trips around Shanghai.
From large Shanghai parks to museums, and Chinese cultural sites to farms, these field trips are integrated into the broader YCIS curriculum.

programs.program_name: Upper Primary Educational Trips and Overnight Camps

evidence.quote: Our Year 5 and 6 students also have the chance to develop independence and collaboration skills outside of the classroom during overnight camps throughout the school year.
YCIS students in Years 7-9 travel to key cultural areas in China through our Education Outside of the Classroom (EOTC) programme.
Recent locations including Xi'an, Shandong, and Fujian.

programs.program_name: High School Educational and Service Trips

evidence.quote: IGCSE students have an abundance of community service opportunities and take educational and service trips within China.

Many of our students embark on a visit to one of our Seeds of Hope Schools - local Primary schools located in small, rural villages in regions throughout China which are supported by the YCIS charity programme - in order to complete service and volunteer.

unknowns: Frequency and duration details of High School service trips
Specific names of overnight camp locations for Upper Primary
